wikipedia_page.main: Howard George Henry  Kearns,  (13 May 1902 in Friern Barnet, London  – July 1986 in Sedgemoor, Somerset ) was a researcher in entomology. He was a long-time researcher at the University of Bristol and the Deputy Director of its Long Ashton Research Station. He was awarded an Honorary Degree (Doctor of Science) by the University of Bath in 1967. His knowledge of entomology and engineering influenced the design of spraying equipment before and after the Second World War.
